emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Code Synthesis
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems capable of writing entire codebases from high-level specifications, reducing human coding time significantly.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to a shift in job roles from coding to problem specification, raising issues about job displacement and skill relevance.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption depends on AI's ability to handle complex and nuanced software requirements, trust in AI-generated solutions, and integration with existing development tools.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Lace
emerging_technologies.description: A mesh-like electronic device implanted in the brain to enhance cognitive functions and interface with digital systems.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Raises ethical concerns about privacy, autonomy, and potential for misuse by corporations or governments.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires breakthroughs in biocompatibility, regulatory approval, and public acceptance of invasive technology.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: Blockchain systems leveraging quantum computing for enhanced security, faster transaction validation, and complex problem solving.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could revolutionize security but also poses risks if quantum computing breaks current encryption standards.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Depends on advancements in quantum computing hardware, standardization of quantum-resistant algorithms, and industry willingness to transition.

emerging_technologies.name: Autonomous Urban Planning
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems that design and optimize urban landscapes for efficiency, sustainability, and livability.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promotes sustainable development but might overlook human-centric design nuances, requiring oversight.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption hinges on data availability, regulatory frameworks for AI in urban planning, and public trust in AI decision-making.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Powered Collaborative Development Environments
mainstream_technologies.description: Development platforms where AI assists in real-time coding, debugging, and version control, enhancing productivity.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in tech companies, with significant impact on developer productivity and software quality.

mainstream_technologies.name: Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS)
mainstream_technologies.description: Systems in vehicles that automate driving tasks to increase safety, comfort, and efficiency.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Standard in new vehicles, with ongoing improvements towards full autonomy.

epoch_themes.description: Technologies enhancing human capabilities, both physically and cognitively, through integration with digital systems.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Potential for increased productivity and quality of life, but also significant ethical and privacy concerns.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing interest in transhumanism, with regulatory bodies starting to address implications.

epoch_themes.description: Focus on making cities smarter, more sustainable, and livable through technology integration.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Improved quality of urban life, reduced environmental footprint, but challenges in equitable access and privacy.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Growing urban populations driving demand for sustainable solutions, international cooperation on smart city initiatives.
